labels.Congratulation! Welcome to EspoCRM: Congratulation! EspoCRM has been successfully installed.
labels.More Information:
For more information, please visit our {BLOG}, follow us on {TWITTER}.

If you have any suggestions or questions, please ask on the {FORUM}.
labels.share: If you like EspoCRM, share it with your friends. Let them know about this great product.
labels.Database Settings Description: Enter your MySQL database connection information (hostname, username and password). You can specify the server port for hostname like localhost:3306.

messages.Bad init Permission:
Permission denied for "{*}" directory. Please set 775 for "{*}" or just execute this command in the terminal 
{C}
Operation not permitted? Try this one: {CSU}

PHP Error: Extension {extName} is not found.

messages.Thousand Separator and Decimal Mark equa: Thousand Separator and Decimal Mark cannot be equal
messages.mysqlSettingError: EspoCRM requires the MySQL setting "{NAME}" to be set to {VALUE}

apache.linux:
1. Enable "mod_rewrite". To do it run those commands in a Terminal:
a2enmod rewrite 
service apache2 restart

2. Enable .htaccess support. Add/edit the Server configuration settings (apache2.conf, httpd.conf):
<Directory /PATH_TO_ESPO/>
 AllowOverride All
</Directory>
Afterwards run this command in a Terminal:
service apache2 restart

3. Tro to add the RewriteBase path, open a file {API_PATH}.htaccess and replace the following line:
# RewriteBase /
To
RewriteBase {ESPO_PATH}{API_PATH}
apache.windows:
1. Find the httpd.conf file (usually you will find it in a folder called conf, config or something along those lines)

2. Inside the httpd.conf file uncomment the line LoadModule rewrite_module modules/mod_rewrite.so (remove the pound '#' sign from in front of the line)

3. Also find the line ClearModuleList is uncommented then find and make sure that the line AddModule mod_rewrite.c is not commented out.

modRewriteHelp.apache:
API Error: EspoCRM API unavailable.
Possible problems: disabled "mod_rewrite" in Apache server, disabled .htaccess support or RewriteBase issue.
Do only necessary steps. After each step check if the issue is solved.
modRewriteHelp.nginx:
API Error: EspoCRM API unavailable.
Add this code to your Nginx Host Config (inside "server" block):
{0}
modRewriteHelp.microsoft-iis:
API Error: EspoCRM API unavailable.
Possible problem: disabled "URL Rewrite". Please check and enable "URL Rewrite" Module in IIS server
modRewriteHelp.default:
API Error: EspoCRM API unavailable.
Possible problem: disabled Rewrite Module. Please check and enable Rewrite Module in your server (e.g. mod_rewrite in Apache) and .htaccess support.
